a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share in poverty vs. life expectancy, 2023
The poverty line of $3.65 per day is set by the World Bank to be representative of the definitions of poverty
lower-middle-income countries. Life expectancy is measured as the average number of years a newborn would
live if age-specific mortality rates in the current year were to stay the same throughout its life.
Share of population below $3.65 per day
Data source: UN, World Population Prospects (2024); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)
Note: Poverty data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured
after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita.
